Title: Batik semiotics as a media of communication in Java
Source title: Cultura. International Journal of Philosophy of Culture and Axiology
Affiliations: Study Program of Marketing Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Yunus, U., Study Program of Marketing Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Tulasi, D., Study Program of Marketing Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Batik industry, Indonesia's traditional practice of dying cloth through wax resist methods, is considered an important source of intangible cultural heritage and protected under UNESCO. The industry is very diverse and many different colors and motives are used. Research in this article focuses on Batik in Yogyakarta, Surakarta, Lasem, Tuban and Garut regions. This paper studies the connotative implications of Batik's cultural significations that pass on from older to younger generations revealing the importance of visuality and touch in constructing meaning within certain cultures.
Author Keywords: Batik; High context culture; Java; Semiotics
